name: disarmingly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that makes someone like you, especially when they had expected not to: "Yes, of course, you're absolutely right," he says disarmingly. The manager was disarmingly honest about the situation.
More examplesFewer examplesHer answer is disarmingly simple.When I finally settle down to interview him, I find him disarmingly friendly. He is passionate about his job and disarmingly frank. She is disarmingly modest about her achievements.He introduced himself to me with a warm handshake and a disarmingly genuine smile.
